flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500>>500 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500*$.0.25=$152<<500*0.25=152>>152 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500*$.0.5=$250<<500*0.5=250>>250 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $152+$250=$402<<152+250=402>>402 total.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 125.0, not 152.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
